content.text:
# Draft:Wooden Stacking Rings

Wooden Stacking Rings consists of three main parts: the rings, the top, and the base
The base is just a circle with a cylinder on top of it for the rings to go. It also has a rounded bottom for it to be rocked around.
There are 6 different rings each a different size and color. Going from largest to smallest the rings are: , , , , , and .
The top part is in the shape of a sphere and goes on top of the pole and other rings.
The whole toy is made completely out of wood.
It appears in the 2004 version of Language Nursery where it replaced Rock-A-Stack.
It was manufactured by Schylling.
The toy is crooked in Kulam segment.
If you look VERY closely at the pole in the Kulam segment right before the  ring shows up, you can see a faint  line.
Availability
Extremely Rare.
